title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Capricorn (Capricorn), from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Capricorn (Capricorn), from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, pink/tan watercolor, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image borderd in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, upper center:  Le Capricorn, lower center:  qui est-ce qui me chatouille donc là? [who is tickling me over there?];  in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  12
description: Scene inside a barn.  A man lying on the ground, center middleground, leaning on his left arm, while holding his head with his right hand.  Two wine bottles are next to him, his hat, right foreground, is to his left.  Behind him a goat in his stall nuzzles the back of the man's head.  The man exclaims, "Who is tickling me there?"  An amorous couple, left rearground, stand in the doorway.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Capricorn (Capricorn), from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, pink/tan watercolor, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image borderd in pen and brown ink. 
1989-13-47
